Package camzup.core

Class Mesh2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.EntityData
camzup.core.Mesh
camzup.core.Mesh2
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEntityData, IMesh, IUtils, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Mesh2
extends Mesh
Organizes data needed to draw a two dimensional shape using vertices and faces. Given that a mesh is primarily a collection of references, it is initialized with null arrays (coordinates, texture coordinates and indices). These are not final, and so can be reassigned.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description

    The type of polygon produced by the static polygon function.

      public static final Mesh2.PolyType DEFAULT_POLY_TYPE

    • coords

      public Vec2[] coords
      An array of coordinates in the mesh.

    • texCoords

      public Vec2[] texCoords
      The texture (UV) coordinates that describe how an image is mapped onto the geometry of the mesh. Typically in the range [0.0, 1.0].

  • Method Details

    • calcUvs

      public Mesh2 calcUvs()
      Attempts to calculate texture coordinates (UVs) for a mesh. Does this by calculating the object-space dimensions of each coordinate, then using the frame as a reference for new UVs.
      Returns:
      this mesh
      See Also:
      calcDimensions(Mesh2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2), Vec2.div(float, Vec2, Vec2)

    • insetFace

      public int[][][] insetFace​(int faceIdx)
      Insets a face by calculating its centroid then easing from the face's vertices toward the centroid by 0.5.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • insetFace

      public int[][][] insetFace​(int faceIdx, float fac)
      Insets a face by calculating its centroid then easing from the face's vertices toward the centroid by the amount, expected to be in the range [0.0, 1.0] . When the amount is less than 0.0, the face remains unchanged; when the amount is greater than 1.0, then the face is subdivided by centroid.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      fac - the inset amount
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • insetFaces

      public Mesh2 insetFaces()
      Insets all faces in the mesh once.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • insetFaces

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this mesh

    • insetFaces

      public Mesh2 insetFaces​(int itr, float fac)
      Insets all faces in the mesh for a given number of iterations by a factor in the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      itr - the iterations
      fac - the inset factor
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • reframe

      public Mesh2 reframe()
      Centers the mesh about the origin, (0.0, 0.0) and rescales it to the range [-0.5, 0.5]. Parallel to p5.Geometry's normalize method.

      this mesh
      See Also:

    • subdivFace

      public int[][][] subdivFace​(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face. Defaults to centroid-based subdivision.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceCentroid

      public int[][][] subdivFaceCentroid​(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by calculating its centroid, cutting each of its edges once to create a midpoint, then connecting the midpoints to the centroid. This generates a quadrilateral for the number of edges in the face.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceFan

      public int[][][] subdivFaceFan​(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by calculating its centroid, then connecting its vertices to the centroid. This generates a triangle for the number of edges in the face.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaceInscribe

      public int[][][] subdivFaceInscribe​(int faceIdx)
      Subdivides a convex face by cutting each of its edges once to create a midpoint, then connecting them. This generates peripheral triangles and a new central face with the same number of edges as the original. This is best suited to meshes made of triangles.
      Parameters:
      faceIdx - the face index
      Returns:
      the new face indices

    • subdivFaces

      public Mesh2 subdivFaces()

      public Mesh2 subdivFacesCentroid​(int itr)

      Parameters:
      itr - iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • subdivFacesFan

      public Mesh2 subdivFacesFan​(int itr)
      Subdivides all faces in the mesh by a number of iterations. Uses the triangle-fan method.

      itr - iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

      public Mesh2 subdivFacesInscribe​(int itr)

      Parameters:
      itr - iterations
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • toSvgString

      public java.lang.String toSvgString()
      Renders this mesh as an SVG string. A default material renders the mesh's fill and stroke. The background of the SVG is transparent.
      Returns:
      the SVG string

    • toSvgString

      public java.lang.String toSvgString​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float width, float height)
      Renders this mesh as an SVG string. A default material renders the mesh's fill and stroke. The background of the SVG is transparent. The width and height supplied form both the view box dimensions, the translation and the scale of the shape. The origin is expected to be in unit coordinates, [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the origin x
      yOrigin - the origin y
      width - the width
      height - the height
      Returns:
      the SVG string

    • toSvgString

      public java.lang.String toSvgString​(Vec2 origin, Vec2 dim)
      Renders this mesh as an SVG string. A default material renders the mesh's fill and stroke. The background of the SVG is transparent. The width and height supplied form both the view box dimensions, the translation and the scale of the shape.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      dim - the dimensions
      Returns:
      the SVG string

    • arc

      public static final Mesh2 arc​(float startAngle, float stopAngle, float oculus, int sectors, Mesh2 target)
      Creates an arc from a start and stop angle.
      Parameters:
      startAngle - the start angle
      stopAngle - the stop angle
      oculus - the size of the opening
      sectors - number of sectors in a circle
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the arc

    • arc

      public static final Mesh2 arc​(float startAngle, float stopAngle, float oculus, int sectors, Mesh2.PolyType poly, Mesh2 target)
      Creates an arc from a start and stop angle. The granularity of the approximation is dictated by the number of sectors in a complete circle. The thickness of the arc is described by the annulus. Useful where sectors may be faster than the Bezier curves of Curve2.arc(float, float, float, camzup.core.ArcMode, Curve2) or where there is an issue rendering strokes.
      Parameters:
      startAngle - the start angle
      stopAngle - the stop angle
      oculus - the size of the opening
      sectors - number of sectors in a circle
      poly - the polygon type
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the arc

    • arc

      public static final Mesh2 arc​(float startAngle, float stopAngle, float oculus, Mesh2 target)
      Creates an arc from a start and stop angle.
      Parameters:
      startAngle - the start angle
      stopAngle - the stop angle
      oculus - the size of the opening
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the arc

    • arc

      public static final Mesh2 arc​(float stopAngle, Mesh2 target)
      Creates an arc from a stop angle. The start angle is presumed to be 0.0 degrees.
      Parameters:
      stopAngle - the stop angle
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the arc

    • calcDimensions

      public static Vec2 calcDimensions​(Mesh2 mesh, Vec2 target, Vec2 lb, Vec2 ub)
      Calculates the dimensions of an Axis-Aligned Bounding Box (AABB) encompassing the mesh.
      Parameters:
      mesh - the mesh
      target - the output dimensions
      lb - the lower bound
      ub - the upper bound
      Returns:
      the dimensions

      rows - number of rows

      the plane

    • plane

      public static final Mesh2 plane​(int cols, int rows, Mesh2.PolyType poly, Mesh2 target)

      Parameters:

      rows - number of rows
      poly - the polygon type
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the plane

    • ring

      public static final Mesh2 ring​(float oculus, int sectors, Mesh2 target)
      Creates a regular convex polygon with an opening in its center. The oculus describes the relative size of this opening.
      Parameters:
      sectors - the number of sides
      oculus - the size of the opening
      target - the output type
      Returns:
      the ring

    • ring

      public static final Mesh2 ring​(float oculus, int sectors, Mesh2.PolyType poly, Mesh2 target)
      Creates a regular convex polygon with an opening in its center. The oculus describes the relative size of this opening. When the polygon type is NGON, the ring will be composed of quadrilaterals; otherwise, triangles.
      Parameters:
      oculus - the size of the opening
      sectors - the number of sides
      poly - the polygon type
      target - the output type
      Returns:
      the ring

    • uniformData

      public static Mesh2 uniformData​(Mesh2 source, Mesh2 target)
      Restructures the mesh so that each face index refers to unique data, indifferent to redundancies. As a consequence, coordinate and texture coordinate are of equal length and face indices are easier to read and understand. Useful for making a mesh similar to those in Unity. Similar to 'ripping' vertices or 'tearing' edges in Blender.
      Parameters:
      source - the source mesh
      target - the target mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh
